symptoms: Dark concentric lesions on older leaves
Tomato___Early_blight.remedy: Remove affected foliage, apply appropriate fungicide such as chlorothalonil or mancozeb following label instructions.
Tomato___Early_blight.prevention: Practice crop rotation, avoid overhead irrigation, and use resistant varieties when available.

Tomato___Late_blight.remedy: Apply systemic fungicides and remove infected plants; destroy infected debris.
Tomato___Late_blight.prevention: Improve drainage, avoid overhead watering, and monitor weather conditions for high-risk periods.

symptoms: Dark lesions on leaves and stems
Potato___Late_blight.remedy: Use certified seed, apply fungicides (e.g., metalaxyl mixtures), remove and destroy infected plants.
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Maintain good field drainage and avoid excess nitrogen fertilization.

symptoms: Olive-green to brown velvety lesions on leaves and fruit
Apple___Apple_scab.remedy: Apply recommended fungicides during green tip to petal fall and remove fallen leaves.
Apple___Apple_scab.prevention: Plant resistant cultivars and remove leaf litter.

*__healthy.prevention: Maintain good cultural practices and monitor regularly.
